meanings.sent1: After the car stalled, he had to redrive it to get it moving again.
meanings.sent2: She had to redrive the nail into the wall because it was loose.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to redrive the toy car down the ramp for more fun.
meanings.sent4: He had to redrive his point home during the debate to make sure everyone understood.
meanings.sent5: The farmer had to redrive the sheep back into the pen after they escaped.

meanings.definition: A device used to transmit power from one part of a machine to another.
meanings.sent1: The redrive in the engine helped transfer power efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic inspected the redrive to ensure it was functioning properly.
meanings.sent3: The redrive in the clock made a funny noise, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The redrive in the car acted like a bridge between the engine and the wheels.
meanings.sent5: The redrive in the windmill was essential for generating electricity.

meanings.definition: The act of driving or propelling something again.
meanings.sent1: The redrive of the boat was necessary to reach the shore.
meanings.sent2: He performed a redrive of the lawnmower to clear the overgrown grass.
meanings.sent3: The redrive of the ball back to the player surprised everyone with its speed.
meanings.sent4: Her redrive of the story made it even more exciting than before.
meanings.sent5: The redrive of the rocket launch was a success, reaching new heights.
